PLUME: Kousa, your handiwork is impressive as ever! The <color=orange>Gravity Crystal Workshop's</color> shelves are always stocked full of crystals of perfect symmetry each time I visit.
2
1
KOUSA: Plume, my old friend! You have returned from your expedition safely! Has the ocean planet been treating you well?
3
2
KOUSA: And yes, yes - the recent meteor storms have broken off more tiny pieces of Brittle Hollow's undercrust, giving me tons of material to carve into new crystals.
4
3
KOUSA: Now, what brings you here to my humble workshop today?
5 4
PLUME: Kousa, I have already been back for some time. We ate together the previous day!
6 5
PLUME: Do you not recall? You invited me to your workshop to show me an invention you engineered to help our expedition team weather the terrible storms on the ocean planet!
7 6
KOUSA: Oh... Yes, yes, of course! How could I have forgotten? I wanted to show you my newest invention! It is right outside - I have named it the storm shelter!
8 7
KOUSA: The storm shelter is a device that generates a gravity field designed to hold Nomai in place in zero-gravity environments, perfect for protecting Nomai when islands are lifted into space.
9 8
KOUSA: This is our first collaboration with the..... The...
10 9
PLUME: The <color=orange>Sunless City?</color>
11 10
KOUSA: Yes, yes! The <color=orange>Sunless City!</color> They kindly shared their technology with us to power this invention.
12 11
KOUSA: Thanks to their contributions, the device can autonomously power itself when the island is launched into orbit, and even deactivates on its own afterwards, conserving power!
13 12
PLUME: How incredible! I must thank our friends from the <color=orange>Sunless City</color> when set off for our next expedition together.
14 13
PLUME: And of course, you have my deepest gratitude for your wisdom and hard work engineering this device, Kousa! This device shall make our stay on such a turbulent planet much safer.
15 14
KOUSA: Oh, it is no problem.. Finding new ways to make use of artificial gravity is one of the few things that keeps this old heart beating proudly.
16 15
KOUSA: Now, why were you here again?
